FuncDef: The reset nat statistics command deletes NAT statistics on a device.
CLIs: reset nat statistics table history slot <slot-id> [ engine <engine-id> | card <card-id> ]
reset nat statistics table history slot <slot-id>
reset nat statistics { discard | global | received | all [ history ] | alg | transmitted } slot <slot-id> [ engine <engine-id> | card <card-id> ]
reset nat statistics { discard | global | received | all [ history ] | alg | transmitted } slot <slot-id>
reset nat statistics { discard | global } nat-instance <instance-name> [ slot <slot-id> ]
reset nat statistics { discard | global } nat-instance <instance-name> [ slot <slot-id> [ engine <engine-id> | card <card-id> ] ]
reset nat statistics received payload slot <slot-id> [ engine <engine-id> | card <card-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the CPU ID of a service board. This parameter takes effect only on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 3.

Specifies the CPU ID of a subcard on a service board.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 1.

Deletes historical table statistics about NAT services.
-

Deletes statistics with the word historical prefixed in the display nat statistics command output.
-

Specifies the slot ID of a service board.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Deletes the number of dropped NAT packets.
-

Deletes the number of received NAT packets.
-

Deletes the number of sent NAT packets.
-

Deletes statistics about a specified NAT instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Before you collect NAT statistics within a specified period of time, delete existing NAT statistics using the reset nat statistics command. Then run the display nat statistics command to view NAT statistics.
Configuration Impact
The reset nat statistics command deletes NAT statistics, without affecting NAT services. Deleted statistics cannot be restored.
Precautions
Check whether you need to delete NAT service statistics before running the reset nat statistics command. After the command is run, the deleted records cannot be restored. Therefore, exercise caution when using this command. The system does not display any message after NAT statistics are deleted.
The reset nat statistics payload slot command is applicable only to the LPUF-51-E/LPUI-51-E/LPUI-51-S.
The reset nat statistics payload command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
